channel.title: Technology - WSJ.com
channel.description: Read the latest Technology news covering smartphone trends, AI, insights from industry leaders and Personal Tech columnists from the Wall Street Journal
channel.copyright: Copyright © Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: The Chinese Company Taking On the World’s Memory-Chip Giants
item.description: As AI demand drives prices up, CXMT is overcoming Washington’s curbs to take on Micron and South Korean leaders.
item.dc:creator: Yang Jie
Jiyoung Sohn

item.title: Job Seekers Find a New Source of Income: Training AI to Do Their Old Roles
item.description: Buzzy AI startup Mercor employs tens of thousands of white-collar contractors, and the gig is open to anyone with expertise in their own particular field.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Bindley

item.title: Google’s AI Advantage
item.description: Plus, tech billionaires’ ‘Save California’ Signal Chat, highlights from the year’s biggest gadget show, the woman running SpaceX and more, in this edition of the Technology newsletter.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Blunt

item.title: Google Bets on AI-Based Shopping With New AI Agents for Retailers
item.description: The search giant is making its first foray into purpose-built AI agents for retail. Meanwhile, major chains are already preparing for the wave of AI agent-based shopping.
item.dc:creator: Belle Lin

item.title: Climbing Bots, Smart Bricks, Super-Bright TVs: The Best Stuff From Tech’s Biggest Gadget Show
item.description: Searching for what’s new—and what’s real—coming out of CES 2026.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Nguyen

item.title: It’s a Weird Time to Be a Democrat in Silicon Valley
item.description: What was once a hot romance has been fractured by AI, President Trump and rising populism.
item.dc:creator: Tim Higgins

item.title: X Faces U.K. Probe Over Grok’s Sexualized Images
item.description: The country’s communications watchdog is investigating X over concerns linked to its Grok AI service.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: OpenAI Reaches Truce With Advocacy Group Over Dueling Child-Safety Measures
item.description: ChatGPT’s maker will commit $10 million to support a compromise ballot measure co-written with Jim Steyer’s Common Sense Media.
item.dc:creator: Laura J. Nelson
Keach Hagey
Sam Schechner

item.title: OpenAI, SoftBank to Invest $1 Billion in SB Energy
item.description: SoftBank’s company is working with OpenAI to help develop its artificial-intelligence infrastructure platform Stargate.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Hamilton

item.title: AI Is Mining Our Trash for Treasure
item.description: Plus, hospitals embrace AI—for better and worse—and scientists create a robot smaller than a grain of sand.
item.dc:creator: Conor Grant

item.title: Meta Unveils Sweeping Nuclear-Power Plan to Fuel Its AI Ambitions
item.description: The Facebook parent will back nuclear projects with Oklo, Bill Gates-backed TerraPower, and Vistra.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hiller

item.title: Our AI Future Is Already Here
item.description: Plus, new dietary guidelines, Monte Carlo for low rollers and stylish spaces to unplug.
item.dc:creator: Cristina Lourosa-Ricardo

item.title: Three Reasons We Can’t Get Enough of LinkedIn
item.description: LinkedIn has lured people leaving X and Facebook as content moderation and fact-checking there declined.
item.dc:creator: Stu Woo

item.title: Testing AI Fitness Coaches
item.description: Plus, how to ignore online noise, OpenAI’s big pay packages and what’s ahead in the chip wars, in this edition of the Technology newsletter.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Nguyen

item.title: I Tested an AI Fitness Coach Who Wouldn’t Accept Any of My Excuses
item.description: New virtual trainers from Fitbit, Peloton and Apple aim to keep your workouts on track.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Nguyen

item.title: Your Key Survival Skill for 2026: Critical Ignoring
item.description: In an age of endless low-quality information, it’s time to fight our instinct to seek out and absorb all we can. It takes practice.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Mims

item.title: Revolution Medicines Draws Takeover Interest
item.description: The cancer-drug biotech firm has a market value around $20 billion.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan D. Rockoff
Lauren Thomas
Cara Lombardo

item.title: This Startup Wants to Bring Cancer Patients Care at Home
item.description: Galway, Ireland- based Luminate Medical just raised $21 million to begin in-home delivery of drug infusions as it also develops devices to lessen the side effects of chemotherapy.
item.dc:creator: Brian Gormley

item.title: Ph.D.s Can’t Find Work as Boston’s Biotech Engine Sputters
item.description: A life-sciences job in Boston used to be a sure path to a high-paying career, but empty labs and unemployed grads now herald tougher times in the city.
item.dc:creator: Jared Mitovich

item.title: Startup Lifordi Seeks to Deliver Potent Medication for Autoimmune Diseases
item.description: Lifordi Immunotherapeutics and other biotechnology companies are using antibodies to precisely target drugs in the body.
item.dc:creator: Brian Gormley

item.title: Sanofi to Buy Vaccine Maker Dynavax in $2.2 Billion Deal
item.description: The French drugmaker is looking to dealmaking after some experimental drugs missed their goals in clinical studies or were turned down by regulators.
item.dc:creator: Adrià Calatayud

item.title: Opinion | Go Around and Strangle Things
item.description: Wall Street uses roll-ups to buy growth. There’s a much more effective alternative.
item.dc:creator: Andy Kessler

item.title: Opinion | Why Is Boston’s Biotech Industry Struggling?
item.description: The U.S. excels at funding discovery and celebrating breakthroughs, then neglects the hard work of manufacturing them at scale.

item.title: Opinion | 1970s Coffee-Machine Chaos
item.description: The more things change . . .

item.title: Opinion | Social Media Is a Trap for Politicians
item.description: I’m swearing off Instagram and X, where it’s too easy to get a distorted sense of the public’s concerns.
item.dc:creator: Vivek Ramaswamy

item.title: Opinion | The Screens Hijack My Class
item.description: I don’t know how much longer I can pretend students sitting under LED lights while staring at an iPad is normal.

item.title: Opinion | How AIDS Helps Cure Cancer
item.description: Scientists learned to treat deadly diseases by using viruses to deliver cutting-edge genetic therapies.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Crisman

item.title: AI Is Causing a Memory Shortage. Why Producers Aren’t Rushing to Make a Lot More.
item.description: Sandisk, Western Digital, Seagate and Micron need to keep undershooting demand.
item.dc:creator: Dan Gallagher

item.title: The Signal Chat Where Silicon Valley Is Plotting Against California’s Billionaire Tax
item.description: Tech elite exchange criticism and tips about a wealth-tax proposal that has sent some billionaires shopping for homes elsewhere.
item.dc:creator: Emily Glazer
Juliet Chung

item.title: Elon Musk Relies on Gwynne Shotwell to Make SpaceX Soar
item.description: Shotwell has an expansive role at the rocket and satellite company, helping to foster its rise. With an IPO looming, the toughest stretch may still lie ahead.
item.dc:creator: Micah Maidenberg

media:content.media:credit: Nadia Radic for WSJ: CHANDAN KHANNA/AFP/Getty Images; Ringo Chiu/ZUMAPRESSERGIO FLORES/AFP;Getty Images;

item.title: xAI, Under Fire for Sexualized Child Photos on Grok, Restricts Tool
item.description: Researchers say the company is bringing dangerous imagery into the mainstream. Grok overnight switched off image creation for nonsubscribers.
item.dc:creator: Georgia Wells

item.title: Our AI Future Is Already Here, It’s Just Not Evenly Distributed
item.description: The opportunity for everyday folks to enhance their lives and work with AI has never been greater, but it can take experimentation and persistence.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Mims

item.title: The Best E-Readers for Every Kind of Book Lover
item.description: We hit our reading goals testing these devices to see which are the most rewarding to read on.

and

item.title: The Best Noise-Canceling Headphones
item.description: We tested noise-canceling headphones in the bustle of Grand Central Terminal, and these are the best.

and

item.title: This is the Best Cooling Pillow for a Good Night’s Sleep
item.description: Upgrade your bed with our top-rated pick.

item.title: What Time Should You Wake Up? Probably Not 5 a.m.
item.description: Sleep experts warn against rising too early if you’re not naturally a morning person, and provide other tips for a better night’s sleep.
